qas.question: What is the focus of the Congo's industrial production?
What are two issues in the Congolese government?
What did petroleum production replace as the focus of the economy?
What percentage of the Congo's gross domestic product did petroleum account for in 2008?
What percentage of exported goods did oil account for in 2008?
What is not a part of Congo's economy?
What is the smallest part of the industrial sector?
What is characterized by under staffing?
What percent of the GDP did forestry account for in 2008?
What percent of exports in 2008 were handicrafts?

context: The economy is a mixture of village agriculture and <b5_0>handicrafts<b5_0/>, an industrial sector based largely on <b6_0>petroleum<b6_0/>, support services, and a <b7_0>government<b7_0/> characterized by <a1_0>budget problems and overstaffing<a1_0/>. <a0_0>Petroleum<a0_0/> extraction has supplanted <a2_0>forestry<a2_0/> as the mainstay of the economy. In 2008, oil sector accounted for <a3_0><b8_0>65<b8_0/>%<a3_0/> of the GDP, 85% of government revenue, and <a4_0><b9_0>92<b9_0/>%<a4_0/> of exports. The country also has large untapped mineral wealth.
